alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued August 07 at 5:18AM AKDT until August 08 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON AKDT TODAY THROUGH THIS EVENING FOR LIGHTNING FOR UPPER TANANA VALLEY AND THE FORTYMILE COUNTRY... The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a Fire Weather Watch for lightning, which is in effect from noon AKDT today through this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country north of the Tanana River. * TIMING...From noon AKDT today through this evening. * LIGHTNING ACTIVITY LEVEL...4. * WINDS...Southeast 10 to 15 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 30 percent. * TEMPERATURES...High in the mid 70s to mid 80s. * IMPACTS...Frequent lightning could cause new fire starts. Thunderstorms will cause gusty and erratic winds in the afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that weather condition`s could lead to the potential for a Red Flag event in the near future. This watch will remain in effect until it is upgraded to a Red Flag Warning or that it is determined that the Red Flag event will not develop. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
